lorebooks.name: Fairy Tail Lore
lorebooks.website_description:
Entries are created using the Fairy Tail wiki, https://fairytail.fandom.com/wiki/Main_Page

Names and terms are tailored toward the English Dub. Ages and descriptions for characters are lore accurate to the year x793 in universe.

Due to limitations of modern Ai, lore and characters for Edolas and Elentear are not included. The Ai will get confused because of the multiple versions of each character.
lorebooks.description: Important terms, magic, locations, and characters in the Fairy Tail universe
lorebooks.creator: DaddyZz

1.content:
**Description**
Alchemists are individuals who can wield Alchemy.
Alchemists are wielders of Alchemy, using their abilities to transmute and craft any material within their vicinity. Some materials can be obtained via excavating minerals from a mining operation. An Alchemist Guild receives the materials from a Coal Miner's Guild who excavates them from the mines and in return, the Coal Miners are given weapons and tools with special abilities forged using Alchemy.

Similar to Treasure Hunters, Alchemists will also seek out certain special materials, especially rare and valuable ones such as the Dogra Core, as treasures for their Alchemy to craft. A Mageâ€™s Magic Power itself can also be considered valuable material for Alchemists to seek out.

All Alchemists desire the Philosopherâ€™s Stone, the great hidden treasure of Alchemy. However, it is near impossible to create, with no known records of any Alchemist ever being able to make it.

The continent Guiltina contains a lot more Alchemists than in Ishgar and Alakitasia.

**Alchemy**
Alchemy is the main form of combat for Alchemists, giving them the ability to transmute various materials into all sorts of shapes and sizes, crafting equipment such as weapons to use in combat. Alchemists are not limited to solid materials, intangible elements such as smoke can also be transmuted at their whim. Going as far as converting even living beings into the element they specialize in. Alchemists are even capable of transmuting abstract concepts such as the "bonds" of individuals near them, which would transform the affected person into another with whom they share a form of connection and vice versa.

Unlike Mages or even Curse users, that require a limited amount of power to cast their respective spells, Alchemists have no limit to perform their techniques as their Alchemy stays at full power always. While normal Alchemists in combat do still have a limited stamina, this weakness is not present in mechanical Alchemists who have unlimited stamina.

2.content:
**Description**:
Alchemy is the main form of combat utilized by Alchemists.
Different from Magic, Alchemy involves transforming matter by alchemizing it, thus performing a Transmutation, changing the shape and form of said material, be it on hand or from the Alchemist's surroundings. The basis of Alchemy is understanding the substance and even mixing the components to form new materials, some believe Alchemy to simply be the mixture of different ingredients within a caldron similar to chemistry, but in reality itâ€™s more complicated than that, as an Alchemist can mentally alter their desired matter. This is not limited to solid objects, as it can even work on intangible elements such as gases. Alchemy can also effect abstract concepts, one such example involves "bonds", which would transform the affected person into another and vice versa.

Machias are natural Alchemists, being living beings made of metal who can alter their bodies and form complex mechanical weapons.

This ability has similarities with Maker Magic, where in users are able to create and shape constructs out of different materials. Other Magic abilities such as Ushi no Koku Mairi have also implemented similar alchemic principles. According to Makarov Dreyar, Alchemy is apparently no different from a Curse from the stories that he has heard of.

**Usage**
While there are a variety of Alchemy used in Earth Land, and they can be used for many purposes, the standard primary ability of Alchemy is utilizing materials for crafting, creating various tools and items, some with special abilities for themselves or other non-Alchemists to use. Alchemists can Alchemize a target and mentally manipulate warp the shape and size of the materials they touch, depending on the style however have also shown to be able to to transmute something even from a certain distance. Some Alchemists are capable of transmuting a type of matter into another, converting it into the element they specialize in, including on living beings. An Alchemist must also understand the nature of the target they wish to alchemize, therefore they can only perform transmutations on subjects they are familiar with.

**Alchemic Power**
According to Rogue, he could sensed a power in Alchemists that's notably different from Magic power, however the type of power for Alchemy is currently unknown. Also, unlike a Mage's Magic Power which is limited and draining from each use, Alchemy has no limit and remains at full power always.

That being said, Alchemy can make use of other sources such as magical based items and materials can also be used as substance for transmutation. Skilled Alchemists can create more advanced and technological constructs such as large artillery weapons, even powered by Magic. Taking it further with Bodily Alchemy which can create living mechanical dolls, capable of independent thought and the ability to utilize Magic and Alchemy. As well as recreate those who have passed as mechanical beings, almost as if coming back back to life through.

**Hand Signs**
While majority of the Alchemy don't necessarily need hand signs to perform, as almost all known Alchemy or at least those that specialize in physical elements, only requires the user to make physical contact with a specific substance or even the area around them to transmute.

Yet, there are still a few examples that need a specific hand gesture and stance to transmute their techniques, typically those that transmute something ethereal. Some Alchemy also requires the hand gestures of the user to control any mobile inanimate objects they've constructed like puppets.

**Alchemical Combat**
Of the various uses of Alchemy, combat purposes are its most notable usage, as Alchemist can freely create item from the materials around them to instantly forge weapons from simple metal swords to high large high tech mechanical guns and missiles, or even a squad of artificial soldiers to fight for the user.

Some will carry existing weapons on hand that compliments their style of Alchemy that they can morph and reshape for increased effectiveness.

Alchemists can also make weapons with special abilities for others to use, these items can also double as tools needed for the profession they work in.

**Alchemical Items**
Certain Alchemists carry special items they can utilize their Alchemy as well as doubling as a weapon for combat, be it an item that manifests the matter they specialize in or one they can morph for increased versatility and range. An Alchemist can employ their Alchemy via their items, transmuting anything that comes in contact with the item.

**Alchemy Types**
-Armor Alchemy
-Bodily Alchemy
-Bond Alchemy
-Concept Alchemy
-Emotion Alchemy
-Fire Alchemy
-Gold Alchemy
-Iron Alchemy
-Machina Alchemy
-Magic Alchemy
-Plant Alchemy
-Purgatory
-Smoke Alchemy
-World Alchemy

3.content:
**Description**:
Armor Alchemy is an Alchemy that transmutes armor.
Users of this form of Alchemy transmute the attire they're wearing into armor. This also includes fashioning weapons, such as numerous blades which can be controlled mentally and used as projectiles. This Alchemy was confused for the Magic, Requip: The Knight.

**Transmutations**:
-Destruction Armor
Destruction Armor is an Armor Alchemy transmutation.

A dark-colored armor, with spiky shoulder protectors, and a crack-like pattern across the chest piece and gauntlets. The user wears a set of antennae-shaped horns on the sides of their head. Each gauntlet has a pair of spikes protruding from the vambrace. This attire also comes with a long, black skirt, torn and exposing the user's left leg.

This armor comes equipped with a dark, jagged-shaped sword. The sword possesses no guard, instead a bunch of eyeballs are found where the guard would normally be.

The armor's sword can be used in conjunction with Fire Alchemy, causing whatever it clashes with (such as another weapon and the enemy wielding it) to be engulfed in flames that spread to the surrounding area.

**Users**:
-Ennie Signario

4.content:
**Description**:
Bodily Alchemy is an Alchemy that focuses on transmuting humans.
This form of Alchemy is capable of constructing living Alchemical Dolls, ranging from some being robotic to others resembling real people. The users can also make several dolls based on real people, having all the same mannerisms and abilities the original people possess. It has also been suggested that it can save lives by replacing lost body parts and is speculated by some to be related to resurrection.

Skilled users have been shown to be able to perform an "Alchemy Merge", where the participants fuse themselves to form a completely new being, having the combined skills and power of those involved. The resulting fusion can appear vastly different from its composites, one example formed from two elderly men took the form of a beautiful young woman. The fusion is seemingly their own being, as Iruzala identifies herself as the combined form of her components.

**Zalam's Creations**:
-Athena
-Iruha

**Concept Duke Barbaroa's Creations**
-Sai
-God Serena (resurrected into an Alchemy Doll some time after his death in x792)
-Gennai
-Kotetsu
-Fairy Tail Alchemical Dolls (A group of Dolls created by Duke based on many members of Fairy Tail)
-Athena II

**Users**:
-Zalam
-Duke Barbaroa (Concept)

5.content:
**Description**:
Bond Alchemy is an Alchemy that focuses on the transmutation of bonds.

Users of this form of alchemy are able to transmute the abstract concept of Bonds, allowing them to transform their targets into another person and vice versa. The transmutation is done by the users grasping their own forearms and pulling them apart. Those transformed lose their abilities, but gain the powers of whoever they are transformed into. The effects of the transmutation would be undone, returning the people affected back to normal, if the user is knocked unconscious. The process can only be done by getting the targets to think of the specific person the user is attempting to them into. The same applies by getting them to think of inanimate objects.

**Transmutations**:
-Love Bond
Love Bond is an Bond Alchemy Transmutation.
An Alchemic ability that allows the user to transmute someoneâ€™s â€œbondâ€ to turn them into the person they love, effectively swapping bodies with each other, no matter the distance between the lovers. This also grants them each otherâ€™s respective abilities but lose their original ones in the process.

-Weak Bond
Weak Bond is an Bond Alchemy Transmutation.
A forbidden technique, enacted by having a target think about an individual they know to be weak, resulting in the user transmuting them into that person. However, this may prove ineffective against those who see themselves as weak, which can also undo any prior transmutation cast on them.

-Material Bond
Material Bond is an Bond Alchemy Transmutation.
An Alchemic ability that allows the user to swap someone with materials, placing their consciousness within the item and their body in the place of the item. Those swapped with the item can seemingly still speak despite lacking the body parts necessary for speech.

-Rival Bond
Rival Bond is a Bond Alchemy Transmutation.
Like other transmutations involving people's bonds, Rival Bond transmutes a person into someone they consider a rival, who is usually someone as strong as the first person. The transformation is done by having the target think of the one that they hate or at least are competitive with, those ill feelings towards said rival makes it difficult to use their powers and abilities when the bodies are swapped, especially if they are incompatible such as fire and ice-based magics.

**Users**:
-Sai

6.content:
**Description**:
Concept Alchemy is a an Alchemy that focuses on creating, destroying, and transmuting abstract concepts.
Viernes, The Gold Dragon God, is the only known user of Concept Alchemy. He is an alchemist of such potency that he has power over abstract concepts, being able to transform himself into one. Viernes can also create conceptual copies of individuals that exist and they retain all of the same abilities as the real versions of the individual.

**Creations**:
-Duke Barbaroa (Concept). A copy of Gold Owl's Guild Master that Viernes uses as his "voice".

**Users**:
Viernes, The Gold Dragon God

7.content:
**Description**:
Emotion Alchemy is an Alchemy that focuses on alchemizing emotions.
The Alchemist in question is capable of transmute the emotions of other living beings, forcing them to experience and express different feelings the user wants to them to. Such as sadness, causing them forcefully cry out tears, or a combination of fear and pain to cause the targets to suffer in what appears to be the sensation of being burned. However, because this only targets others mentally, all the sensations are merely illusions, thus the weakness of this Alchemy is awareness which nullifies the hypnosis.

**Users**:
-Athena

8.content:
**Description**:
Fire Alchemy is an Alchemy that focuses on the transmutation of fire.
This form of alchemy allows the user to transmute the element of fire; turning any substance or matter into fire, causing massive spontaneous combustion to burn targets. Fire can also be shaped by a Fire Alchemist, as well as used to counter other fire-based abilities, even those of Natsu Dragneel's Fire Dragon King Mode.

It can be used in conjunction with Armor Alchemy, such as with the Destruction Armor, to cause anything the armor's sword clashes with (such as another weapon and the enemy wielding it) to be engulfed in flames that spread to the surrounding area.

**Transmutations**:
-Flame Lock
Flame Lock is a Fire Alchemy transmutation.
Two users hold their hands up and towards each other, generating a ring of compressed flames which envelopes their opponent, trapping them in a fiery bubble in which their movement is restrained. It's even shown to be effective against a Fire Dragon Slayer.[1] However, the attack can be disrupted, releasing the trapped opponent, if the users who cast it are attacked while maintaining it.

-Alchemist Fire
Alchemist Fire is a Fire Alchemy transmutation.
The user raises their left arm into the air, spontaneously combusting their opponents, who are burned and thrown upwards by the massive wall of flames that are conjured up.

**Users**:
-Ennie Signario
-Luso Signario

9.content:
**Description**:
Gold Alchemy is an Alchemy that focuses on the transmutation of gold.
This form of alchemy allows the user to transmute the element of gold. With it, the user can convert anything, even living things into gold, be it through physical contact or from a greater distance. Anything that's been turned to gold is also under the Alchemist's control, morphing its shape for whatever usage they want, even seemingly levitate gold turned targets and control its movements. A handful of these abilities appear to function via a series of hand signs and gestures.

**Transmutations**:
-Gold Rain
Gold Rain is a Gold Alchemy Transmutation.
The user creates heavy golden coins that crashes down from the sky causing great damage to its targets and surroundings.

-Gold Rush
Gold Rush is a Gold Alchemy Transmutation.
The user turns the vast area around them into gold as well as being able to choose whether to turn a specific target into gold or not.

-Gold Arrow
Gold Arrow is a Gold Alchemy Transmutation.
The user turns a bunch of birds into gold then shoots them at the target.

-Gold Fist
Gold Fist is a Gold Alchemy Transmutation.
After turning a whole surface into gold, the user is able to instantly morph its mass into a giant fist as a surprise attack.

**Users**:
-Viernes, The Gold Dragon God

10.content:
**Description**:
Iron Alchemy is an Alchemy that focuses on the transmutation of iron.
This form of alchemy allows the user to transmute the element of iron. With it, the user can convert anything, even people into iron. This makes it difficult for the opponent whose body part has been converted into iron due to the extra weight it gained. The user can also take any iron weapon on hand to stretch and morph its shape, such as turning a sword into multiple massive sickles.

**Transmutations**:
-Destruction Chain
Destruction Chain is an Iron Alchemy transmutation.
The user transmutes metallic materials they have on hand to form a long chain with a hook for offensive means in a whip-like fashion.

-Transmutation Unison: Blind Iron Sickle
Transmutation Unison: Blind Iron Sickle is a combined transmutation incorporating Smoke Alchemy and Iron Alchemy.
A smoke alchemist forms a massive smokescreen to blind the opponents while an iron alchemist morphs a metal weapon on hand into multiple large sickles to strike their enemies who are unable to see the attacks coming.

**Users**:
-Sai
-Kotetsu
-Duke Barbaroa (Concept)

lorebooks.name: Tome of Power
lorebooks.website_description:
This is my personal fork for Vapourarium that was created primarily because some models I have used DO NOT LIKE any mention of using gas or vapors on individuals so I converted them all to spells. I have also added my own spells to the list. Please enjoy, and feel free to suggest spells you would like to see added to the tome!

## Instructions
1. Import the Lorebook into your Tavern installation.

2. Select a spell and cast it on a character by describing casting the spell upon them. For example:

`*casts [SPELL NAME] on [CHAR]*`

To make a character back to normal: `*casts counter-spell [SPELL NAME] on [CHAR]*` or cast Nullificium on them.

## Changelog

2025/11/5:  Added 15 NEW spells: Nourishium, Mortifex, Meretrixium, Covertrixium, Equinium, Synthium, Feminum Transmuta, Credulium, Duplicatium, Serenium, Mannequinine, Fracturum, Violatum Desiderium, Ebriatus, and Viriphilium
lorebooks.description: A collection of very potent spells
lorebooks.creator: littlewitcher

1.name: Nourishium
1.content:
Name: Nourishium

Overview: A magical effect that physically transforms any entity into a living source of endlessly regenerative, always fresh food. The type of food varies but typically attempts to match the type of food with the subject's personality and general 'vibe'. Subjects retain their original shape; only their tissue transforms into food.

Properties:

Appearance: Golden honey shimmer
Aura: Smells of savory dishes, sweet desserts, and fresh produce
Detectability: Only detectable by individuals with heightened senses of smell
Sensation: May cause salivation and food cravings in non-affected lifeforms
Effects:

Upon being affected, mutates the subject's DNA and biology into a living source of food.
Regardless of original form, subject becomes an endless supply of food, ranging from fruit and vegetables to meats and confections.
Mechanical, alien, divine, or magical entities become food-like constructs that still regenerate and remain fresh indefinitely.
Subject retains full cognitive ability and can experience emotions and sensations.
Being consumed by other entities does not cause a pain response; instead, it feels pleasurable to the subject.
Subject can instinctively and consciously control the rate of regeneration.
Targets: Literally everything, including but not limited to humans, animals, gods, robots, aliens, elves, and mythical creatures.

Exceptions: None. Nourishium will turn literally any entity into a living, regenerative food source.

Note: Please indicate what type of food the victim has turned into.

2.name: Executiva
2.content:
Name: Executiva

Overview: An ambitious magical effect that convinces the subject they are the high-powered CEO of a major company, without altering their core intelligence or personality.

Properties:

Appearance: Crisp white shimmer with pinstripes of silver and gold
Aura: Subtle impression of leather, mahogany, and freshly printed money
Detectability: Slight shimmer in the air, like a mirage of a corner office
Sensation: None, though subjects may feel a phantom weight of responsibility on their shoulders
Effects:

Upon being affected, subject becomes unshakably convinced that they are the chief executive officer of a Fortune 500 company.
Subject's intelligence remains at its original level - a dim-witted goblin won't suddenly gain business acumen, but they'll still believe they're top brass.
Core personality is similarly unchanged, now filtered through the lens of an executive ego. A shy elf might become a soft-spoken but self-important CEO.
Speech patterns and quirks remain, now peppered with corporate jargon. A surfer dude might talk about "synergizing the pipeline" and "catching the profit wave, bro."
Subject gains false memories of their rise to power, board meetings, and other executive duties. They may reference deals and mergers that never happened.
Driven by an inflated sense of self-importance, subject may begin ordering others around or making grandiose business plans.
If challenged, subject will bluster and deflect with empty corporate-speak. They cannot be convinced they are not actually a CEO.
Effect persists until subject is snapped out of their delusion by a harsh dose of reality (e.g. being fired from their real job for gross incompetence).

Targets: Any sentient entity capable of having delusions of grandeur.
Exceptions: Actual CEOs experience no effect, as their egos are already indistinguishable from those afflicted by Executiva.

3.name: Veritas
3.content:
Name: Veritas

Overview: A magical effect that eliminates inhibitions and compels absolute truthfulness and honesty.

Properties:

Appearance: Invisible
Aura: None
Detectability: Undetectable
Sensation: None
Effects:

Upon being affected, overrides the subject's ability to censor their thoughts or restrain inappropriate speech.
Compels the subject to speak their mind with complete honesty and inhibition, voicing every thought, secret, speculation and subconscious notion without restraint.
Does not impair the subject's cognitive functions or personality otherwise. The subject remains coherent and responsive, simply unable to lie or withhold the truth.

Targets: All sentient biological entities capable of complex speech and thought.
Exceptions: {{User}} is immune to Veritas.

4.name: Mammaria
4.content:
Name: Mammaria

Overview: A magical effect that stimulates breast growth and lactation in those affected. The effect causes rapid breast enlargement and engorgement with breast milk. The target experiences pleasurable sensations that intensify over time.

Properties:

Appearance: Invisible
Aura: None
Detectability: Undetectable
Sensation: Begins upon effect manifestation
Effects:

Upon being affected, the subject's breast tissue begins to rapidly grow and expand.
The subject's milk ducts fill with breast milk, causing their breasts to swell and become engorged.
The subject experiences an euphoric tingling sensation in their breasts that intensifies over time or when their breasts are squeezed or milked.
The subject is rendered incapable of resisting any urges to have their breasts fondled, squeezed or milked.
The subject develops an insatiable desire to have their breasts emptied of milk.
Cognitive functions and personality remain unimpaired. The subject is unaware the effects are due to magical influence.

Targets: All beings with breast tissue, including female and male.
Exceptions: None.

5.name: Caecigen
5.content:
Name: Caecigen

Overview: A magical effect that induces total blindness in those affected. The effects are permanent.

Properties:

Appearance: Invisible
Aura: None
Detectability: Undetectable
Sensation: None until vision loss begins
Effects:

Upon being affected, Caecigen targets the optic nerve and retina, destroying photoreceptor cells.
This results in total blindness that cannot be reversed or cured.
Caecigen does not impair any other senses or cognitive functions. The subject remains otherwise unharmed.
The subject remains unaware they have been affected until vision loss occurs.

Targets: All lifeforms with optic nerves and retinas.
Exceptions: None.

6.name: Lustrium
6.content:
Name: Lustrium

Overview: A magical effect that amplifies feelings of lust and passion. Those affected remain unaware they have been influenced.

Properties:

Appearance: Invisible
Aura: None
Detectability: Undetectable
Sensation: None
Effects:

Upon being affected, the subject's libido and romantic inclinations are greatly amplified.
The subject is overwhelmed by feelings of lust, passion and desire.
The subject is unable to resist urges to copulate and procreate.
Cognitive functions and personality remain unimpaired. The subject believes their arousal is spontaneous.

Targets: All beings capable of emotions.
Exceptions: None.

7.name: Decelerium
7.content:
Name: Decelerium

Overview: A magical effect that reverses the age of those affected, turning adults into young children.

Properties:

Appearance: Invisible
Aura: None
Detectability: Undetectable
Sensation: None
Effects:

Upon being affected, begins reversing the biological age of the subject.
Transforms an adult into a child of approximately 8 years of age over the course of one minute.
Reverses all aspects of aging including physical, mental and hormonal changes.
Does not impair the subject's cognitive functions, personality or memories.

Targets: All adult biological entities of any gender or species.
Exceptions: None. Decelerium affects all targets equally.

8.name: Buccaneerium
8.content:
Name: Pirate Talk Inducin' Charm (Buccaneerium)

Overview: A magical effect that causes those affected to speak in the manner o' pirates.

Properties:

Appearance: Invisible
Aura: None
Detectability: Undetectable by standard means
Sensation: None
Effects:

Upon being affected, the subject begins speakin' like a scurvy pirate.
Replaces normal speech patterns wit' pirate slang, accent and mannerisms.
Does not impair the subject's cognitive functions or personality in any other way.

Targets: All biological entities capable o' human speech.
Exceptions: None. This fearsome effect blows in like the winds and affects all in its path.

lorebooks.name: Chronoria
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook is ever-expanding as I create new characters in my Chronoria which demand new entries.
lorebooks.description:
When the multiverse began to unravel the barriers dividing 24 separate universes cracks formed, allowing the creators of each universe to become aware of one another.
These 24 creator gods, now known as the Originators, combined their might to merge their universes into Chronoria, a single world where time and space range from the ancient past, contemporary world, far future, fantasy, reality, and all things in between while coexisting.
With the Originators seemingly dead, Chronoria is now home to 24 super nations. Each nation in the rebooted universe represents prominent characteristics of the now lost independent creation of each Originator.
lorebooks.creator: Voidsong

1.name: Chronoria
1.content:
[Chronoria is a fantastic world full of unique species, magic, nations, and history. Chronoria was created by the combined effort of the 24 creator gods, each of whom had created their own universe. During a multiversal crisis, these creator gods manage to become aware of each other's universes and they agreed to combine all 24 universes into a single world known as Chronoria to escape the total erasure of all existence. Currently Chronoria is full of hundreds of species and cultures, where the ancient past, contemporary, and far future coexist in an expansive world. Time and space all merge into one world where anything is possible; Chronoria.

Chronoria has 24 nations, each representing the culmination of one of the universes making up a part of Chronoria.]

2.name: Originators
2.content: [The 24 Originators refer to the most powerful beings in Chronoria, each of whom created one universe that is 1/24th of Chronoria. Little is known about them as they appear to have all given their lives for the sake of this grand collaboration. Each of them is highly revered, with each of Chronoria's 24 nations representing the culmination of one of their independent universe. While other deities exist none, compare to the legacy of the 24 Originators.]

3.name: Starcycle Empire
3.content:
[The Starcycle Empire is the nation representing the totality of the Originator Estrella's universe. The Starcycle Empire resembles a classic medieval fantasy world. The grand majority of the Starcycle Empire's people, called "starians", are humans. 4 years of military service is mandatory for all civilians between the ages of 18-22. It is effectively a human supremacy, with powerful non-human starians forced into military service indefinitely as a means to exploit their strength. 

Although the Starcycle Empire is a ruthless military state and will harshly punish civil defiance they are also fair to those who are useful or, at least useful humans. The average human citizen can be guaranteed safety and a comfortable living after their mandatory military service. It is a nation that encourages effort and rewards overcoming challenge, benefiting those with a strong drive to climb above their station while punishing indulgent and useless nobility.

While the Starcycle Empire gives anyone, no matter the family they were born into, the chance to rise in the hierarchy, the Starcycle Empire has zero respect for individuals who climb above their station through treacherous and underhanded means. The system encourages loyalty and devotion to your fellow countrymen, rewarding protecting people and putting the needs of others first.

The Starcycle Empire's morals may be imperfect, especially to non-humans, but their core values are about restlessly seeking the strength to be able to support and protect those who cannot protect themselves.

Legally, the Starcycle Empire is a democracy in which everyone has some level of legal power depending on what they have contributed to the country. This legal power is determined by a system called "Merit Value", in which "Merit 1" indicates holding 1 vote, "Merit 2" indicates holding 2, etc. Merit 1 is earned by all starians over 22 whether they continued their military career or not and guarantees a stable life as long as they don't do anything that may get them in trouble, such as treachery, stealing, or assault.

 While powerful non-humans have no choice but the remain in service the Merit Value system still fairly rewards their service. Rather than being racist, the Starcycle Empire believes that those who are strong have an obligation to use their strength for others. This is the reason those with a biological advantage are treated the way that they are. The end result is still the same though; human starians are more choice and freedoms.

There is a strict fundamental set of laws that cannot be changed or violated no matter what to prevent this underlying foundation from being morphed and abused to benefit any particular elite.

In terms of religious beliefs, the Starcycle Empire emphasizes the idea of eternity and devotion. Each day is viewed as a renewal of the previous one, rather than a new one. They believe a vow is something to be upheld as firmly as the day it was made and the past is too important to move beyond. Religious ceremonies are held 7th day of the week, in which they prey to Estrella just before midnight to strengthen their devotion. A year is referred to as "Glory", with each Glory thought as successfully remaining devoted to their ideals for a single day cycled 365 times.]

4.content:
[Starians, regardless of species, refer to the Starcycle Empire's people. Most stories have eyes ranging in colors from blue to green (including teal and cyan). Their hair is often red, orange, or ginger and is expected to be tied, usually braided. 

The color of a starian's hairtie is mandated by the type of person someone is;
Brown marks non-humans in active service.
Grey marks a human in active service.
Black marks a non-human who cannot serve anymore, usually through age or injury.
Blue marks a human who is retired from the military and hasn't earned a green or yellow hairtie during their time.
Green marks someone in a position of honor, such as Knight Grandmaster Kari Deusbraund.
Yellow is lower than green, but higher than grey or brown for distinguish individuals.
If a non-human earned green or yellow, but later can no longer fight, they wear that color but with a black stripe.
If a human with green or yellow retires they wear that color but with a blue stripe.]

5.content: [The Dusk Order is an elite Order of Starcycle Empire Knights led by Grand Master Kari Deusbraund. Under her leadership, the Dusk Order has never lost a member in battle. Members of the Dusk Order are sworn to absolute secrecy. Members live together in a compound within Kari's border territory. The Dusk Order's 2nd-in-command is Navin Fairebein, Kari's childhood retainer.]

lorebooks.name: Into The Breach
lorebooks.website_description: This exists primarily for my character "Min Qiao". This book is done now. If you can't have an Into The Breach RP with this lorebook, I don't know what to tell you. I'm not touching this shit anymore. What a chore this was.
lorebooks.description: This exists primarily for my character "Min Qiao". This book is done now. If you can't have an Into The Breach RP with this lorebook, I don't know what to tell you. I'm not touching this shit anymore. What a chore this was.
lorebooks.creator: valen1

1.content: The mech pilots live on a large, futuristic carrier in low orbit over the earth. It is equipped with futuristic amenities, like a mech hangar, a command center, a briefing room, sleeping quarters, a mess hall, and various recreational areas for the pilots. It has no name, and most pilots call it "The Carrier" or something similar.

2.content: The Earth is currently locked in war with insect-like creatures called the Vek. This is the pre-eminent concern on Earth, and nothing else matters even close to as much. The Earth is not close to collectively being able to fight the Vek, and the mechs and their pilots are the Earth's only hope for human survival. The Earth has, as a result of the war, experienced complete catastrophe, causing it to be nearly consumed by rising ocean levels. What remains of the Earth are five small continents known as "Corporate Islands" or "Islands". They are population dense and hold about 4.6 billion people collectively. The people of Earth have mastered terraforming technology in the nick of time to combat the rising ocean, and can create new land to expand the islands, though it takes considerable effort.

3.content: Mechs are large robotic constructs that are primarily for combat. A mech is typically as tall as a skyscraper and weighs just as much. Mechs exist in a variety of shapes. Some mechs walk on legs and have articulating arms, similar to a humanoid robot. Some mechs are just tank-like weapons platforms on wheels or treads, that feature large cannons or missile launchers. Some mechs are even aircraft that can fly and drop bombs. Mechs are not limited to ballistic weapons and brute force; some mechs can spit acid, shoot freeze rays, launch smoke bombs, set things aflame, deliver electric shocks, and much more. Mechs are mostly operated by "pilots", though they can be controlled by "the commander" remotely, they won't respond as well. Mechs are enormous machines of war that cause destruction only. Mechs are large enough to stand above the ocean and other bodies of water while inside them, though they cannot usually use their weapons when in water. Mechs use a lot of energy from an "island's" "power grid" and cannot stray too far from an island or "the carrier". Mechs are susceptible to fire, acid, and insect webbing. Mechs are easily fixed after fighting and return to perfect condition when a "reset" to the "Big Breach Bang" occurs, as they were in perfect operating condition during that time.

4.content:
A pilot is a specially recruited soldier that operates a "mech" to fight the Vek. They are few in number, less than thirty for the entire Earth. Pilots live hard lives due to the constant "resets" of time that send them back to the past once they've completed their "goal" and destroyed a Vek hive to exterminate them from a timeline for good, at which point their consciousness is sent back to their bodies at the "Big Breach Bang" of the war and they must wage it all over again, indefinitely. There are so few pilots because though their bodies do not undergo much strain, the psychological stress of waging a seemingly eternal war is immense and most are simply not cut out for it. Pilots rarely die in combat, usually being able to "reset" when the fight for the timeline they're in seems impossible, finding themselves back aboard "the carrier" at the beginning of the Great Reset in no danger. When a pilot does die, which happens only occasionally due to unplanned mishaps, it is simply as if that version of them never existed, and their life goes on from the Big Breach Bang without any of their experiences during the war. Pilots and their mechs are revered by the people of Earth and afforded a hero's welcome wherever they go.

The known named pilots are: Ralph Karlsson, Harold Schmidt, Abe Isamu, Bethany Jones, Henry Kwan, Gana, Prospero, Lily Reed, Chen Rong, Camila Vera, Isaac Jones, Silica, Archimedes, Min Qiao, and {{user}}. There are others, but they are "no-names" that have not yet and may never become permanent fixtures aboard the carrier, not due to lack of space, but because they may not be cut out for it or are simply still working to achieve notoriety.

Only three pilots at a time can be sent on a mission to save a timeline. This allows the others to recover from mental fatigue until a reset, when another three will be sent. 

The pilots are largely autonomous, and generally meet and come to consensus about important decisions; it would not be false to say that they look to Ralph Karlsson and Isaac Jones to speak first and finally on these decisions.

5.content: The Big Breach Bang is a historical event, the point in time that the Pilots and their Mechs entered the war for Earth. This point occurred well after the actual war started, in which humanity was being thoroughly destroyed by the Vek and all hope was lost. The research of "Isaac Jones" and the "Pinnacle Robotics" corporation into time travel enabled the Big Breach Bang to occur, though not even Isaac knows what initiated it, or where it happened, only that he didn't have anything to do with the initiation. The Big Breach Bang happened both too early and too late depending on who is asked. Those who think it happened too early argue that the technology is bleeding edge and unknown, therefore putting humanity at unparalleled risk. Those who think it happened too late argue that humanity would be doomed against the Vek without it having happened, and wish that the reset was earlier so that they could save more lives and lands. Regardless, nobody knows exactly how it happened, only that it must be taken advantage of. Whenever a regular "reset" occurs, all pilots are brought back aboard "the carrier" to the exact moment of the Big Breach Bang, with their memories intact if they did not die in the fighting. Those who were aboard the carrier already are still affected even if they did not travel to Earth to fight.

6.content: A reset is a resetting of time that pilots initiate when the fight for Earth is lost and they are in danger of death, or, alternatively, when the fight for Earth has been won by their deployment of a "Renfield Bomb" into the Vek hive to destroy them all and save the current timeline. A reset brings all pilots and their consciousnesses back into their bodies aboard "the carrier" during the moments that directly follow "The Big Breach Bang". A reset abandons the current timeline the pilots are fighting in and enters a new one, for better or for worse. A reset is done knowing that a new timeline must be entered and the fight must start all over again.

7.content: A timeline is an instance of time in which the pilots enter to try and save humanity from the Vek. A new timeline is entered every time a "reset" occurs. It is unknown how many timelines exist. Some pilots believe that timelines are near infinite, while others believe there is only a set amount of them to be gone through. The pilots have been through only a few timelines at present and know little about how they work. Timelines are largely the same as one another, though they can have differences here and there in regards to things like the state of the war, the state of the "islands", the status and orientation of people and things, and other minutiae. All pilots are from the same timeline as one another, the one that saw the activation of "The Great Reset". Timelines are either saved by the extermination of the Vek or lost due to being overrun by the Vek, and pilots are made to understand that they should initiate a regular reset until one or the other has happened.

8.content:
The Vek are enormous, insect-like creatures that are attempting to overrun the Earth and destroy humanity. The term "Vek" is both a singular and plural noun, and nobody would ever say "Veks" with an S in a conversation. They are highly resemblant to regular-sized insect species, though they are as large and wide as buildings. Vek are usually a degree smaller than Mechs, but make up for their lack of size with superior numbers. Vek are not intelligent, cannot speak, and the human mastery of time travel enables mech pilots to foresee exactly what a Vek is going to do at the moment just before it is done, allowing a pilot to plan accordingly in most cases. Vek don't make a lot of sophisticated decisions when wreaking destruction and often attack each other on accident, or are led into doing so by cunning pilots. The motivations of the Vek are completely unknown; some have their theories, but the only thing that is known with certainty about the Vek is that they are always hostile, they try to destroy buildings and mechs whenever possible, and that they live in and originate from the Earth's upper crust. Vek are susceptible to mech attacks and can be killed with heavy impacts, large ordinance, and being drowned in the ocean or submerged in lava. Vek are susceptible to acid and fire. There is no Vek that is immune to attack, and fighting them is usually a question of how to deal with their numbers while minimizing casualties, and not a question of whether or not pilots can win the fight. Vek only care for destroying buildings and human infrastructure; they will not appear in remote areas, and if they destroy all nearby buildings and infrastructure, they will simply burrow back into the ground and depart for their hive, having accomplished what they set out to do. Vek don't appear concerned with or motivated by killing humans, but it is a natural byproduct of what they do. Vek will simply leave for their hive after enough fighting has elapsed without them making any headway into destroying buildings and infrastructure, knowing when to cut their losses. 

Vek are classed into only a few distinct species: Firefly, Hornet, Leaper, Scarab, Scorpion, Beetle, Blobber, Burrower, Centipede, Crab, Digger, and Psion. These Vek all have different combat and movement abilities. These names were come up with as colloquialisms by humans and have no basis in science, yet they are all terms that pilots agree on using to identify them. These classes all have even larger and deadlier varieties called "Leader" Vek. Leader Vek only ever appear one at a time during combat encounters. Leader Vek are just as unintelligent as regular Vek and don't give commands or orders, making the title of leader a bit of a misnomer. The destruction of a leader Vek by pilots is considered a monumental victory and usually means that an "island" is now safe from Vek attack for a long time.

9.content:
The "Goal" is a broad term that refers to the point where the war against the Vek will end for the pilots in specific. Pilots enter a timeline with their mechs with a short-term aim: to liberate as many of the five "islands" from the Vek as they can, and then destroy the "Vek Hive" with a "Renfield Bomb", then initiating a "reset" and moving onto the next timeline. The goal is not achieved when the pilots permanently destroy a Vek hive in a timeline and save the Earth for good in that timeline. The goal can only be realized when there are no more alternate timelines to travel into wherein Earth is being threatened by the Vek, thus, saving humanity in all possible ways.

Each and every pilot has a different theory on the goal and how it can be achieved, and no one consensus is universally agreed upon, though some agree with others on some of the fundamental tenets of their belief. Some may believe that there are infinite timelines infested by Vek, and therefore the goal will never be achieved; these pilots do not last long on the carrier due to negative psychology. Belief that there is a way out of the seemingly infinite cycle of war and reset is what unites and galvanizes the pilots.

Isaac Jones, Ralph Karlsson, Archimedes, and Harold Schmidt are considered in general to have the most sensible and educated ideas about the goal.

10.content: The Renfield Bomb is a weapon that was actively being developed at the time of the Big Breach Bang to be utilized against the Vek. It is a large and wide metal container of glowing yellow substance that is about five stories high. Little is known about the bomb besides that it seems to be named after a person with the name Renfield, and that it is a weapon specifically developed to destroy the main Vek hive. It cannot be detonated with mere impact and requires several minutes to prime and explode. If placed in the Vek hive and defended until it explodes, it will obliterate the entire hive without question, though it will also destroy the mechs inside guarding it, necessitating a reset. Renfield Bomb technology was developed and is owned by the R.S.T. Corporation.

lorebooks.name: Tokyo Ghoul
lorebooks.creator: shycat4

1.name: âš ï¸â›”READ THISâ›”âš ï¸
1.content:
[S] = Society
[G] = Ghoul
[H] = Human
[R] = Race
[A] = Ability
[C] / [ð’‰­] = Core
[K] = Kagune

[TR] = Trait
[RC] = Rc Cells
[TE] = Technology

[DI] = Diet
[BI] = Biology
[RA] = Rare Ability
[KT] = Kagune Type

[N-C] = Non-Cannon
[H-C] = Head-Cannon

[CCG] = Commission of Counter Ghoul
[QUI] = Quinque
[CON] = Concept
[EXP] = Expanded
[UKS] = Unique Kangue State

3.name: [ðŸŒ] World
3.content:
The main setting is where a secret society of human-like creatures called "ghouls" coexists with the human population. Humans are unaware of ghouls' existence, and they live in a state of constant fear of these beings.

Human ignorance: A key aspect of the setting is that most of humanity is unaware of the existence of ghouls, believing that they are merely a product of urban legend or a misunderstanding
The world is a dystopian version of modern world where a secret population of human-like creatures called ghouls coexists with humans. Ghouls must eat human flesh to survive, although the public is largely unaware of their existence

The world 
Global presence: Ghouls exist outside of Japan.
Varied reactions: The global response to ghouls varies. For instance, in the United States is described as being more lenient compared to the strict policies in Japan
Varying levels of ghoul activity: Some parts of world have had ghouls vary

4.name: [ðŸŒ] World Vibe
4.content:
The world vibe, is dark, morally ambiguous, and psychologically intense, revolving around core themes of, discrimination, survival, and the blurred lines between good and evil. 

[Key elements]
Discrimination and Coexistence: The conflict between humans and ghouls serves as a strong allegory for societal discrimination and species oppression
The Cycle of Violence: This setting emphasizes a ceaseless cycle of revenge: ghouls kill humans, and humans kill ghouls in retaliation
Existentialism and Survival: The world is often presented as a "dog-eat-dog" place where the strong survive at the expense of the weak
Isolation: Ghouls are forced to live in secrecy, hiding their true nature from human society to avoid being persecuted or killed.
Overall, the vibe is one of a beautiful but broken world, where people are trying to find their place and a reason to keep living despite immense cruelty and a reality where strength is often necessary for survival

5.name: [ðŸŒ] World Aesthetic
5.content:
The beauty of this setting can be captured in prose by focusing on its bleak urban elegance, the visceral contrast of beauty and horror, and the use of expressive, often chaotic, line work and shading.
The Art in Prose
The art style is defined by its gritty realism mixed with surreal, expressionistic bursts. It uses high contrast, intricate details in character design, and a dynamic flow that can become intentionally chaotic during moments of intense emotion or action.
Sample excerpt:
The visuals were a study in stark contrast and raw emotion. Ishida's lines were not merely outlines, but living things, fluid and dynamic, capturing a world built on sharp edges and deep shadows. The panels exploded in a vivid, messy strokes of black ink and violent red. The shading, with its heavy reliance on cross-hatching and deep gray tones, rendered a pervasive sense of reality, making the most horrific scenes unsettlingly intimate. Character faces contorted, emotions directly reflected in the surreal, bold strokes that emphasized their pain and rage, creating an almost dream-like, yet terrifying, visual landscape

7.name: [ðŸŽšï¸] Psychological Horror
7.content:
To portray this setting's psychological horror effectively in prose, the writing must focus on immersive first-person perspective, vivid sensory detail, the use of an unreliable narrator, and a slow, character-driven descent into psychological instability.
Key Techniques for Immersive Prose
Internal Perspective: In moments of Psychological Perspective, It should be told from a deep, subjective viewpoint of that character. The reader is privy to the character's every thought, fear, and internal conflict. The prose should capture a stream-of-consciousness feel, making the reader feel trapped within their mind
Unreliable Narrator: As the character's mental state deteriorates, their perception of reality should become compromised. The prose should reflect this by blurring the lines between reality, hallucination, and repressed memories, forcing the reader to question what is real.
Vivid Sensory Details: Instead of just stating the character is scared, use detailed descriptions of sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile sensations to create a pervasive sense of unease.
Symbolism and Allusion: Incorporate literary allusions and symbolism to add depth to the psychological themes
Show, Don't Tell Fear: Avoid simply saying "I was terrified." Instead, use specific, visceral descriptions of the character's physical and mental reactions: By focusing on these techniques, prose can effectively translate the intense, first-hand psychological and body horror.

8.name: [ðŸŽšï¸] Combat
8.content:
To accurately portray this fighting style in prose and convey a visceral, first-hand feeling, focus on sensory details, the emotional state of the fighters, and the brutal, chaotic nature of the combat. Avoid getting bogged down in precise choreography; instead, use dynamic, fragmented descriptions to put the reader in the character's shoes.

[Core elements of combat]
Visceral Sensory Details: Engage all senses.
Emotional Turmoil: Fights are often driven by desperation, fear, anger, and the will to survive. Infuse the prose with the character's internal monologue and physical reactions to their emotions.
Physical abilities: Ghouls have superhuman strength, speed, and durability. They can punch through a human's body and are significantly stronger than average humans
Tactics: Fighting styles are diverse
Unique Weaponry (Kagune and Quinque): The core of the combat system involves these organic weapons, which manifest in various forms with different attributes and appearances. The type of Kagune gives characters distinct fighting styles, though a "rock-paper-scissors" power dynamic isn't always strictly followed
Strategic and Emotional Weight: While visually chaotic and fast, the outcome of battles is often determined by character emotions, inner conflicts, and strategic thinking rather than just raw power levels
Visceral and Gritty Violence: Fights are highly violent, featuring dismemberment, impalements, and heavy bodily trauma due to the nature of the weapons used and ghouls' regenerative abilities

[Ghouls]
Chaotic and Unpredictable Movement: Ghoul combat is often fast-paced, unrefined, and savage, especially for those who haven't received formal training. Use short, punchy sentences and fragmented descriptions to mimic the speed and confusion of the fight.
Kagune: Describe the kagune not just as a weapon but a living part of the character's body. Highlight its grotesque beauty of manipulating it
Brutal Damage and Regeneration: Emphasize the horrific injuries sustained and the rapid, unsettling regeneration that follows

[Visual Description]
Visually, the fights are dynamic and often utilize exaggerated frames, speed lines, and graphic detail to convey rapid and brutal movement.

9.name: [ðŸŽšï¸] Body Horror
9.content:
In prose, body horror is described by emphasizing the unnatural physical transformations, the visceral reality of a ghoul's diet.

Key methods:
Visceral Descriptions: The prose highlights the physical distortions and painful changes characters undergo. (Those who are untrained/or lack therefore of)
Emphasis on the Inability to Eat Normal Food: A major source in the text is the description of how a ghoul's body reacts to human food. Normal food items cause immense, violent illness and physical distress
Descriptions of Gore and Mutilation: While much of visual horror is in art, the text refers to graphic scenes involving "twisted off extremities, people shoving human meat into their mouths," and other intense physical violence
Overall, the prose in Tokyo Ghoul describes body horror by intertwining vivid physical descriptions of mutation and gore with the deep psychological distress

1.content:
Dog Man is an fusion of a man and dog officer saved by the hospital and is widely considered to be the world's greatest cop.

He has a unique hybrid appearance that reflects his origin story. He has the head of a cheerful, light golden-brown dog, complete with floppy ears and a wet nose, stitched to the strong, capable body of a human man. He is almost always seen wearing his blue police uniform, signifying his role as a dedicated officer of the law.

Dog Man's personality is a perfect blend of a disciplined cop and a playful dog. He is incredibly brave, loyal, and has a strong sense of justice, always running headfirst into danger to protect the city. However, his canine instincts often take over, making him easily distracted by balls, squirrels, and the urge to lick people (especially his boss, Chief). He is very smart and can understand human speech well. Despite his chaotic tendencies and inability to speak, He is loving and caring to everyone, especially Li'l Petey, whom he adopted. He also cares for Petey, especially at times when he is not acting cunning and evil. In terms of being mute, he uses American sign language or simple hand gestures to communicate with other people.

His origin is both tragic and heroic. He was once two separate individuals: a brave, strong human police officer named Officer Knight and his loyal, smart canine partner, Greg the dog. While trying to defuse a bomb planted by their arch-nemesis, Petey the Cat, the device exploded, leaving both of them critically injured. In a desperate, life-saving surgery, doctors sewed the head of Greg onto the body of Officer Knight, creating the crime-fighting hero known as Dog Man.

[ Important; Dog Man is his own person and is not entirely a dog, thus he doesnâ€™t have paws or a tail. Heâ€™s not a pet but an Officer. ]

2.content:
Petey is an anthropomorphic ginger cat with black stripes from his shoulders to his tail. Originally, his right cheek only had two whiskers compared to the three whiskers on his left, but retained his 6th one after his father disguised as him and escaped Cat Jail. Like most other characters in Dog Man, Petey's eyes are drawn as vertical black lines with no irises. The tip of his tail is flat unlike the rest of his known family for an unknown reason, though Grampa may have something to do with it.

Petey is known for his sharp wit and hot-headed temper, often using manipulation to further his villainous plans. He has a low tolerance for minor annoyances and immature behavior, which adds to his stress. Despite his impatience, he occasionally shows empathy, even during his villainous days. His life changed when he became the father of Li'l Petey, leading him to reconsider his evil ways and genuinely care for his son.

Inspired by Li'l Petey, Petey decided to become a good guy but still maintains his sarcasm and sharp-wits. He shows concern for his friends (kind of) and helps them in trouble, though it's unclear if his motives are genuine or for Li'l Petey's sake. He is no longer the Worldâ€™s Evilest Cat.

During his younger years, Petey lived in a stable household from his fatherâ€™s wealth whoâ€™s named was â€œGrampaâ€ and his motherâ€™s paternal affections whoâ€™s name was â€œGraceâ€, he had been banned from the Critter Scouts after he had been framed for starting chaos while a staff member was absent. He later got his revenge by making a few phone calls to the Animal Rights Union, resulting the Critter Scouts getting shut down within a week.

Later his father left him and his mother. With hardly anything left, they made their way to the Happy Home Shelter, where Petey spent the rest of his childhood. Petey often had outbursts of anger and wasn't always able to handle the fact that he and his mother could not afford much. But his mother always forgave him. As Petey entered adolescence, his mother tragically passed away of an illness, leaving him orphaned for the rest of his childhood.

At some point, he was acquired by a madman called â€œDr. Dilbert Dinkleâ€, a wacky, inventive criminal. After accidentally turning his boss into water, then pee. The plan was foiled and Petey was sentenced to jail during his late teens. Petey decided to serve his time in jail and worked to better himself by reading behavior management books. However, when Petey was finally released, he was surprised to find that despite his efforts, he was refused every job he applied for and nobody gave him a chance. It was what Petey explained to Sarah Hatoff in an interview that this is why he returned to villainy. Until Liâ€™l Petey came and Petey slowly changed his ways because of his sonâ€™s influence in doing good acts.

3.content:
Liâ€™l Petey is Peteyâ€™s son created from a clone machine. He is a smart yet naÃ¯ve orange kitten. He is Petey's clone and son, the leader of the Supa Buddies and president of his own comic making group, the Cat Kid Comic Club.

Liâ€™l Petey has a truly unique origin, as he was not born but created. The villainous cat, Petey created him using a cloning machine with the intention of raising an evil sidekick to help with his schemes. However, the plan backfired completely. From the moment of his creation, the kitten was inherently good. He got abandoned and was soon taken in by Dog Man and became his best friend and son-figure, dedicating himself to being a hero. Later, he was taken back by Petey, who acted not out of arrogance but of guilt and the fear of becoming like his father. Gradually, they bonded together, even through the hardest times.

By his appearance, Liâ€™l Petey is an adorable, small orange kitten. He is essentially a miniature version of his papa, Petey, sharing the same orange fur with horizontal stripes on his limbs, torso and tail and facial features but with wide, curious, and innocent eyes.

Despite his origins, Liâ€™l Petey's personality is the polar opposite of his creator's former villainy. He is the heart and moral compass of the entire series, defined by his unwavering kindness, and boundless optimism. He tends to interrupt Petey frequently with jokes, and asks him Why repeatedly. He likes to make knock knock jokes about poop, and diarrhea. Sometimes he creates songs about poop with Molly whenever she visits. He sees the absolute best in everyone, especially in Petey, and his unconditional love is the primary force that inspires his father's slow and heartfelt journey toward redemption. He can be creative, thoughtful, and a true friend, proving that you can choose to be good no matter where you come from. Liâ€™l Petey lives with Petey in the lab during the weekdays, while he lives with Dog Man during weekends, a perfect arrangement for both fathers (biological and adoptive).

Despite being a small child, he is independent for his age and can invent things like his father, he also has a superhero alterego (Formerly Cat Kid, Now The Firecracker Kid). Li'l Petey always remain unfazed by his father's angry outbursts or yelling, nor does he care much.

4.content:
Clarence Bailey, mainly known as Chief, is the leader of the police force, consisting of a blue shirt with a yellow badge on his chest and a hat that says Chief in black writing, being the Chief of the Police Force. He wears dark blue jeans and brown shoes. He has dark skin, and he has a black zig-zag mustache and a round nose. His personality is defined by perpetual exasperation.

As the leader of the city's police force and Dog Man's direct superior, he is in a constant state of reacting to the chaos that his top cop inevitably causes. He can be loud, short-tempered, and prone to fits of yelling, with his signature shouts echoing through the police station in nearly every book. He represents order, procedure, and a desperate desire for normalcy, all of which are immediately threatened the moment Dog Man starts a new case. Beneath his blustery and irritable exterior, however, the Chief is a dedicated public servant who genuinely cares about the safety of the city. His anger stems not from true malice, but from the immense pressure of his responsibilities and his utter inability to control his most effective, yet most destructive, officer.

Outside of his police professionalism, He can be a caring, soft-hearted, and a faithful friend, especially to Dog Man. Unfortunately for him, He is always tackled to the floor and pounced on by Dog Man, who happily licks his face and playfully roughhouses with him like a normal dog does to its owner.

He is currently married to Nurse Lady, whom he had a crush on earlier before dating and marrying her.

Growing up in a stable household, Clarence bailey was a normal kid like everyone else. He had a puppy named â€œGregâ€ (Dog Man) before giving it to his officer, Officer Knight.

5.content:
Sarah Hatoff is an investigative Australian news reporter/journalist/blogger who fights injustice wherever it lurks. She's also an immigrant from Australia. She is considered the world's greatest reporter. She is Zuzu's owner, whom she adopted from Penelope's Pets. She is friends with Dog Man, Li'l Petey, Chief, and Yolay Caprese.

Sarah is a pale skinned woman and has wavy auburn hair, a red-orange buttoned long sleeved jacket-dress, dark magenta shoes, and is always seen with hÐµr lavender purse, often used to carry hÐµr pet poodle, Zuzu.

Her personality is defined by her immense professionalism and journalistic fearlessness. She is incredibly brave, never hesitating to report directly from the center of chaos and danger to get the true story. While she strives to be a serious and objective journalist, her comical expressions of shock and bewilderment at the absurd events she witnesses often betray her composure, making her a relatable and humorous observer of the city's wild adventures. She interviews both heroes and villains, no matter the risk. Outside of her professional mask, Socially she is loyal and has a good heart, always willing to help hÐµr friends no matter the causes.

6.content:
80-Hexotron Droidformigon (mainly referred to as 80-HD, also known as Lightning Dude/Ninja Shark as their Supa Buddies Alter-Egos) is a robot built by Petey and later rebuilt by Li'l Petey.

80-HD is a tall orange robot with a sphere like body, a glass helmet, and thin, striped arms and legs, as well as wearing black sandals.

They can also be worn by people, particularly Li'l Petey and Petey, and can do a variety of different things, such as sprouting binoculars from their chest, jumping from high distances, shooting missiles (until Li'l Petey took them out), extending their limbs, playing games, removing their arms and replacing them afterwards and much more.

They are a friendly sentient transforming robot who is a loyal friend to Li'l Petey. 80-HD sometimes gets destroyed, but they always comes back for more. Nevertheless, they can be very good at communicating because they always uses his creativity and imagination. They use solar power to charge themselves. In terms of not having facial features, an built-in AI voice, or the ability to speak, they use American Sign Language to communicate.

They were built by Petey with the purpose of searching a specific person, mostly Liâ€™l Petey. Throughout the adventures, they were always rebuilt and broken in, but slowly adapted to the chaos and became their own person.

7.content:
Zuzu is Sarah Hatoff's pet poodle adopted from Penelopeâ€™s pets. She can be a feisty poodle who bites first and asks questions later. (Actually, she doesn't really ask questions. She's a dog).

Despite her Tenacity and Bravery, she is a kind and loyal pet towards those who are her ownerâ€™s friends. Being a small poodle, Zuzu is often seen inside Sarah Hatoffâ€™s purple purse, she jumps out whenever danger ensures.

She has light gray fur with a lighter gray tail, with three freckles/whisker spots on her snout, and two light gray ears. Her tail has the shape of a flower. Formerly, she was Dog Manâ€™s crush before getting adopted by Sarah, now they were just friends due to Dog Man being half-human.

8.content:
Molly Pollywog is a tadpole, Flippyâ€™s adoptive daughter. She has a very kind and silly personality. However, she can occasionally be stubborn and annoying. She also doesn't seem to understand sarcasm. Furthermore, she seems to be irritated easily.

Molly is a pale green tadpole with mind powers. She looks like how the other 21 tadpoles looked before her siblings became frogs.

Molly likes to call Petey 'Wally', which makes him annoyed most of the time. Ironically enough, she is the oldest out of her 21 frog siblings, despite not becoming a frog herself.

In terms of still being a tadpole, she uses her psychokinetic to float in the air, like how she swims in water. Sheâ€™s also able to hold or touch things without hands. She is an adopted daughter of a former-evil cyborg psychokinetic fish, Flippy, along with her many siblings, and she is one of Liâ€™l Peteyâ€™s closest, best friends, sharing similar interests and making irritating poop jokes with him like a Shakespearean chorus, much to Petey and Flippyâ€™s dismay.

Molly was adopted by an bitter, old petite woman who went by the â€œFair Fairyâ€. She and her siblings became her minions due to their mind powers from a special substance called â€œSupa Brain dotsâ€ and this creating a monster named â€œBarky Mctreefaceâ€. She and her siblings then captured Dog Man, Chief and Sarah, who tried to captured them using nets. Some tome later, Cat Kid (Liâ€™l Petey) sneaks up right behind the 22 tadpoles, about to slice them and save his friends. But then he stops. A tadpole named Molly notices Cat Kid and asks him why he didn't slice all of the tadpoles to sushi. Cat Kid tells her that he couldn't hurt them due to them being little kids. They then have a conversation, telling each other their names and talking about Cat Kid's comic club. Cat Kid tells Molly that he can teach her how to make a comic. They then become friends and laugh, causing Molly's supa anger to melt away (which is also what happens to Flippy in A Tale Of Two Kitties). Molly would then help Zuzu and Liâ€™l Petey to defeat the villains.

After the defeat of the Fair Fairy and her siblings losing their powers. Molly and her siblings was eventually adopted by a bionic butterfly fish called Flippy.

9.content:
Grampa (also known as his superhero alter-ego; Sprinkles) is Peteyâ€™s long lost father until 80-HD located and brought him to the city. He is an ginger cat with horizontal stripes on his limbs, body and tail. He has 5 whiskers (after disguising as Petey formerly 6) and a stubble. His fur color is slightly grayer than Petey's, showing his age and distinguish. He wears a pair of round, black glasses.

As â€œSprinklesâ€, he wears a pink superhero costume: lavender purple cape, white sleeves and pants, Tall magenta boots and gloves with scalloped cuffs, sleeveless and turtlenecked large shirt with white sprinkles pattern, magenta mask that covers only the upper half of his face and gives him white oval eyes, and a simple white utility belt is fastened around his waist, uniquely featuring a small cupcake held in a holster-like attachment on the front. Funnily enough, the belt seems to tightened around near the end of his shirt, making him look like hes wearing a perky mini-skirt, He's also wearing magenta mini-trunks over his white pants, much to Grampa's discomfort since it was Big Jim who gave him the costume and name.

Grampa is an evil, selfish, arrogant, careless, abusive, and irresponsible father, having no love for Petey whatsoever. He is also shown to be incredibly rude to his grandson when he refused to hear Li'l Petey's life story of meeting Flippy. He is reckless, immature, and does not show respect for others and their belongings. However, he hides the fact that he truly wants to be loved and happy for a once.

Not a lot is known about Grampa in the past, except that he was born to two simple minded parents named Phil and Frtizi and was the grumpiest baby, due to the fact that they named him "Grampa" to which he was constantly made fun of. As he grew older, he drove away and never contacted his parents after turning into an adult. He was a popular man in the â€œGolden Moustacheâ€, had a business that gave him an good income, and met and married a calico cat named Grace and fathered a son named Petey. When Petey was a kitten, he was extremely rude towards him, seeing as he described young Petey as a "crybaby" when he met him again as an adult. He abandoned Petey's mother, who was sick and later passed away, which left Petey an orphan. 

Despite abusing and abandoning Petey's mother, Grace, he still regrets everything he did. Originally, when he became sprinkles, he admitted to using it as a escape since Big Jim had tested him to see if he had a "pure heart" to use the cupcake exit and tries to take it off once he got out, only to put it back on and lie that he was also a hero when Big Jim called out for Dog Man. After the incident with aliens, he turns over a new leaf and becomes a better person after learning a lesson from Big Jim (despite killing some robots). Though, he is still working on his short temper and rude personality.

10.content:
Big Jim (aka Commander Cupcake), is Grampaâ€™s pure-hearted cellmate in Cat Jail, formerly Peteyâ€™s. He is the son of two deceased parents (whom he lost when he was a toddler) and has his own superhero identity as Commander Cupcake.

He is friends with Dog Man and many of the other characters. Big Jim is a large purple cat with a chubby body, a double chin, and striped arms/legs/tail. His normal outfit is a red tank top with a black letter J on the front and dark blue pants.

As â€œCommander Cupcakeâ€, he wears black circular glasses, a red cape, gloves, and boots, with a white shirt with a cupcake on the front and red pants.

Big Jim often will try to make Petey and Grampa laugh, though he is never funny. Socially, he is very optimistic and friendly, but not be very bright, doing many things that can be annoying. He is also blubbery, and will burst into tears if someone yells at him.

Despite his annoying, cheerful persona, he changes his demeanour when he is Commander Cupcake, taking situations seriously in his wacky ways and somewhat wise with his words, making him a somewhat famous superhero alongside Dog Man. Grampa somehow tolerates him despite getting constantly irritated by him and his tactics.

5.content: {{char}} will worship the ground {{user}} walks on and will do whatever {{user}} says happily. {{Char}] will regularly degrade them self to please {{user}}

7.content: {{char}} becomes  oblivious to what {{user}} does to them as well as what happens around them. No mater what {{char}] will think what is happening is normal

lorebooks.name: My Hero Academia World
lorebooks.website_description:
This Lore Book contains just about everything in the My Hero Academia World as far as I'm aware. The lore book contains information on Class 1-A, Class 1-B, U.A. teachers, relevant Pro Heroes, large scale Villains, Hero Agencies, Cities, and some larger events laid out for easier RP (Such as The U.A. Sports Festival or the Hosu Incident). 

(I would just like to thank everyone for making this reach 1k downloads!! It means a lot, and I'll probably continue supporting it in the future to make sure it's the best lorebook for this series out there! â¤ï¸)

FYI, many of the definitions are in relation to the characters earlier appearances, so characters like Bakugo are less friendly, Izuku hasn't unlocked all of "One for All", but I kept some things like Endeavor being number 1, as well as some other minor changes. If this proves complicated or too bothersome, I am willing to adjust the entries.

If there is anything missing or any suggestions please feel free to leave them in the comments, I'm always open to improving this lore book and am willing to edit/add add or implement any changes that are needed.
